sentences.en: I don't presuppose that, I know it a bit, I've seen it.
sentences.cn: 俺不是在冒充神棍, 我知道一点点, 我也看到了一点点.

sentences.en: I presuppose that you have done your work.
sentences.cn: 我预料你已经做了你的工作了.

sentences.en: It's dangerous to presuppose that a person is guilty.
sentences.cn: 先假定某人有罪是危险的.

sentences.en: Let us presuppose that he wants money.
Let us presuppose that he wins the game.
sentences.cn: 让我们先假定他赢得这场比赛.

sentences.en: Presuppose everyone else is a part of you, just like one of your own dream characters.
sentences.cn: 假设其余所有人都是你的一部分, 就像你的梦中人物一样.

sentences.en: Teachers sometimes presuppose a fairly high level of knowledge by the students.
sentences.cn: 教师有时候假定学生的知识水平相当高。

sentences.en: The idea of heaven presupposes the existence of God.
sentences.cn: 天堂的说法首先认定了上帝的存在。

sentences.en: These pleas presuppose execution of the will by the testator.
sentences.cn: 这些呼吁假定执行的意愿,由立遗嘱人.

sentences.en: To say that x instantiates a property P is hence to presuppose that x exists.
sentences.cn: 为了说那x,用具体例子说明性质P是因此,x存在假定那.

sentences.en: We cannot presuppose the truth of his statements.
sentences.cn: 我们不能预先假定他的话属实.

words.tran_cn: 假定；预料；以…为先决条件

trans.tran_cn: 假定；预料；以…为先决条件
trans.tran_en: to depend on something that is believed to exist or to be true

trans.tran_cn: 预先假定， 假设，以…为先决条件， 意味着
trans.tran_en: to depend on something that is believed to exist or to be true
